message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.HC, cs.MM

The paper deals with learning and understanding human activities from sensory data, which is a problem that is relevant to several sub-fields of computer science. The use of discriminative models such as CRF and MEMM suggests that the paper is likely to be related to machine learning (cs.LG) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The fact that the experiments are conducted in the video surveillance domain suggests that computer vision (cs.CV) is also a relevant sub-field. The problem of providing intelligent assistance based on activity data suggests that human-computer interaction (cs.HC) may also be relevant. Finally, the use of partially hidden models suggests that the paper may also be related to multimedia (cs.MM).
